location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.57 of 1857 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Commander Felix Jones, Political Agent and Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of receipt of Jones’s earlier letter relating to the wounding and death of a man from Katif [Al-Qaṭīf] by the crew of a boat from Aboothabee [Abu Dhabi]. Anderson requests that Jones sends a further report, that the compensation received from the Shaikh of Abu Dhabi is paid to the relatives of the dead man, and all efforts should be made to save the life of the man imprisoned for the attack.
